review: We gave up on satellite tv several years ago. Too much money, too many annoying commercials. We've rented movies since then and watched some things on the internet on our desktop monitor but that was not very comfortable or convenient. This is great. We can watch anything on you tube on our television now by "casting" from our desktop. We may pick up Netflix also and have unlimited movies for $9.00/mo.. And I think there are many more possibilities that we've yet to look into because, for now, we're just tickled to watch Miss Marple or Sherlock Holmes or Midsomer Murders (We like the British mysteries) etc for free with no commercials. Love it.
author: Steven J Larson

review: Much appreciative of the added apps, such as Hulu and especially HBOGO, but this item is still very glitchy. i have (somewhat reluctantly) purchased 5 of these for use herre, and also my parents home, and have had issues with all 5. Sometimes the usage of the USB does not provide enough power, and even when plugged directly into an electrical outlet, the device can become extremely warm and stop streaming. I learned this while attempting to watch Gravity one night. I know it wasn't just that device, or tv as i used multiple devices on 3 separate and different branded televisions. also, pairing the device can be a pain at times and takes several reboots and unplugging before it is recognized and allowed to be streamed to. I love love love the concept of the device, and the price is definitely on point, I just wish google would fix these glitches, and send out an OTA update to all of us owners that are stuck with.
